required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: mHealth Physical Activity Intervention for Young Cancer Survivors
clinical_study.official_title: Adolescents and Young Adults Becoming Physically Active After Cancer Trial

brief_summary.textblock: In this randomized controlled trial the investigators will determine whether a mobile health intervention can increase physical activity levels in AYA cancer survivors over a one year period. The investigators will recruit 320 cancer survivors in Alberta who were diagnosed with a first cancer between the ages of 15 to 39 years and are within one year of treatment completion. Participants will be randomized into either the control group (educational information) or the intervention group (educational information; personalized physical activity plan; activity tracker watch; access to a private, online survivor community; motivational text messages and check-in calls/e-mails). All participants will complete fitness testing and questionnaires at baseline, 6 months and 12 months. A final measurement at 24 months will test long-term effectiveness.

detailed_description.textblock:
Background:
There is a need for adolescent and young adult (AYA) cancer research because the number of new cancers in young people is increasing and the survivor population is growing. Interventions that try to reduce problems that affect people after cancer are particularly important since its treatments can have negative effects on survivors' physical and mental health even decades after diagnosis.
Aim:
Given the many positive effects of physical activity (e.g. improved fitness and quality of life), the study aims to encourage AYA cancer survivors to be more physically active as they shift from treatment to survivorship care. The main goal of this study is to see if a home-based, mobile health (mHealth) physical activity intervention can increase physical activity levels by at least 90 minutes/week compared to baseline in AYA cancer survivors.
Methods:
The investigators will conduct a two-center randomized controlled trial of 320 AYA cancer survivors. Participants (N=320) will be Albertan residents, diagnosed with a first cancer between the ages of 15 and 39 years, and within one year of cancer treatment completion. At the start of the study, participants will complete fitness testing and questionnaires. Participants will then be randomly put into either a control or intervention group. The control group will receive educational information only. The intervention group will also receive a personalized physical activity plan, an activity tracker watch, access to a private, online survivor community, motivational text messages and check-in calls/e-mails. Fitness testing and questionnaires will be repeated at 6 and 12 months to see if the intervention increased physical activity levels and improved health outcomes among the participants in the intervention group compared to controls. A final measurement at 24 months will test long-term use.

study_design_info.masking_description: The study team, with the exception of the study coordinator, will be blinded to reduce bias.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in weekly minutes of moderate-vigorous intensity physical activity

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in weekly minutes of sedentary time
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by Actigraph

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in weekly minutes of sleep
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by Actigraph

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index (PSQI) Global Sleep Quality Score
secondary_outcome.description: Global score range is 0 to 23 where higher scores indicate worse sleep quality

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in weight
secondary_outcome.description: Measured in kilograms

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in body mass index (BMI)
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by combining height (meters) and weight (kilograms) and reported in kg/m2

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in waist and hip circumference
secondary_outcome.description: Measured in centimeters

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in cardiorespiratory fitness
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by peak oxygen consumption in relative (ml/kg/min) values using the incremental Balke and Ware treadmill test with direct measures of gas exchange and ventilation

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in cardiorespiratory fitness
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by peak oxygen consumption in absolute (L/min) values using the incremental Balke and Ware treadmill test with direct measures of gas exchange and ventilation

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in grip strength
secondary_outcome.description: Measured in kilograms using a hand dynamometer

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in upper body muscular strength
secondary_outcome.description: Measured in kilograms using an 8-10 repetition maximum (RM) chest press test used to predict 1-RM

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in upper body muscular endurance
secondary_outcome.description: Measured in kilograms using the maximum number of chest press repetitions completed at 50-70% of estimated 1-RM

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in lower body muscular strength
secondary_outcome.description: Measured in kilograms using an 8-10 repetition maximum (RM) leg press test used to predict 1-RM

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in lower body muscular endurance
secondary_outcome.description: Measured in kilograms using the maximum number of leg press repetitions completed at 50-70% of estimated 1-RM

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in frailty
secondary_outcome.description: Defined according to the Fried phenotype which takes into account low lean muscle mass, exhaustion, low energy expenditure, walking limitations, and weakness

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the Short Form 36 (SF-36) Mental Health Component subscale
secondary_outcome.description: Score range is from 0 to 100 where higher scores indicate better mental health

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the Short Form 36 (SF-36) Physical Health Component subscale
secondary_outcome.description: Score range is from 0 to 100 where higher scores indicate better physical health

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the Short Form 36 (SF-36) Physical Functioning subscale
secondary_outcome.description: Score range is from 0 to 100 where higher scores indicate higher functioning

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the Short Form 36 (SF-36) Role-physical subscale
secondary_outcome.description: Score range is from 0 to 100 where higher scores indicate higher functioning

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the Short Form 36 (SF-36) Bodily Pain subscale
secondary_outcome.description: Score range is from 0 to 100 where higher scores indicate less pain

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the Short Form 36 (SF-36) General Health subscale
secondary_outcome.description: Score range is from 0 to 100 where higher scores indicate better health

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the Short Form 36 (SF-36) Vitality subscale
secondary_outcome.description: Score range is from 0 to 100 where higher scores indicate higher vitality

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the Short Form 36 (SF-36) Social Functioning subscale
secondary_outcome.description: Score range is from 0 to 100 where higher scores indicate higher functioning

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the Short Form 36 (SF-36) Role-emotional subscale
secondary_outcome.description: Score range is from 0 to 100 where higher scores indicate higher functioning

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the Short Form 36 Mental Health subscale
secondary_outcome.description: Score range is from 0 to 100 where higher scores indicate better mental health

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the Cancer Distress Scales for AYAs Impact of Cancer subscale
secondary_outcome.description: Scores range from 0 to 100 where higher scores indicate more distress

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the Cancer Distress Scales for AYAs Physical subscale
secondary_outcome.description: Scores range from 0 to 100 where higher scores indicate more distress

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the Cancer Distress Scales for AYAs Emotional subscale
secondary_outcome.description: Scores range from 0 to 100 where higher scores indicate more distress

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the Cancer Distress Scales for AYAs Cognitive subscale
secondary_outcome.description: Scores range from 0 to 100 where higher scores indicate more distress

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the Cancer Distress Scales for AYAs Cancer Worry subscale
secondary_outcome.description: Scores range from 0 to 100 where higher scores indicate more distress

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the Cancer Distress Scales for AYAs Employment subscale
secondary_outcome.description: Scores range from 0 to 100 where higher scores indicate more distress

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the Cancer Distress Scales for AYAs Education subscale
secondary_outcome.description: Scores range from 0 to 100 where higher scores indicate more distress

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the Cancer Distress Scales for AYAs Practical subscale
secondary_outcome.description: Scores range from 0 to 100 where higher scores indicate more distress

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy Cognitive Function Perceived Cognitive Impairment subscale
secondary_outcome.description: Score range is from 0 to 80. Higher scores indicate poorer quality of life.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy Cognitive Function (FACT-Cog) Comments From Others subscale
secondary_outcome.description: Score range is from 0 to 16 where higher scores indicate poorer cognition

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy Cognitive Function (FACT-Cog) Perceived Cognitive Abilities subscale
secondary_outcome.description: Score range is from 0 to 36 where higher scores indicate poorer cognition

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy Cognitive Function (FACT-Cog) Impact on Quality of Life subscale
secondary_outcome.description: Score range is from 0 to 16 where higher scores indicate poorer cognition

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy Fatigue (FACT-F)
secondary_outcome.description: Score range is from 0 to 52 where higher scores indicate less fatigue

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the Comprehensive Score for Financial Toxicity (COST)
secondary_outcome.description: Score range is from 0 to 44 where higher scores indicate better financial wellbeing

arm_group.description: The intervention arm will receive a 12 month mobile health (mHealth) physical activity intervention with a goal of increasing their moderate-vigorous intensity physical activity levels by 90 minutes per week above baseline
Controls will receive general health education materials

intervention.description: The intervention includes a physical activity prescription, a Polar activity tracker watch, access to a private AYA cancer survivor community through the Polar Flow community platform, mHealth nudges and surveys via text messaging, and regular phone or email contact from study staff.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Lives in Alberta
- Diagnosed with invasive malignancy in Alberta
- Completed active cancer directed therapy (cytotoxic chemotherapy, radiation therapy and/or definitive surgical intervention) in the last 12 months, except for "maintenance" therapy to prevent recurrences
- Have the ability to read, write and speak English
- Have access to the Internet on at least a weekly basis
- Have a mobile phone with a text messaging plan
- Willing to be randomized to either arm.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Health problems which preclude the ability to walk for physical activity, as measured by the Physical Activity Readiness Questionnaire (PAR-Q)
- Currently pregnant or planning to become pregnant within the next 6 months
- Currently taking part in > 300 minutes/week of moderate-to-vigorous intensity physical activity on a regular basis
